comment: The class is easy enough and he is a normal teacher but the subject is boring.
SO BORING!!!! but if you do what you're supposed to do and go to all the activity days there is no reason why you shouldn't make a low A to a high B.

class is simple and easy. If you actually go to class, read the chapter, and study for the tests  like any good student you will get an A. He is very straight forward and tells you exactly when everything is due in the syllabus at the beginning of the semester. If you fail this class or even get a C it is completely your fault. Getting a B is easy.

He is literally the worst professor I have ever had. Very Cocky. Doesn't explain things well. I normally make very good grades, and I had to study for days for one of his tests to make a B. Unclear, honestly acts like he doesn't care about the class.

Nice professor. Super boring class. Go to class, attend all activity days, and study for tests. The tests are the only difficult thing about the class. All labs are online and he never releases grades, so you don't know what your grade is until right before finals.

Mr.Wilhoyte was alright. he outlined exactly what we needed, and as long as you go to class, do the work and look over your material once in a while, you're alright. he is very laid back, and sets things in proportion. the Final  optional, so long as you haven't missed a test previously, and can only help your grade.

This class is HARD.  Tests are difficult, I haven't passed one yet and I'm an A student!  Go to Activity Days, do critical thinking and labs and you may be able to get a decent grade.  He always lets class out at least 20 minutes early.  Would NOT recommend this teacher.  He is attractive, but his personality is awful.
Horrible teacher. Activity days are a must, which is easy. The tests are extremely hard even if you studied. The powerpoints are useless, read the book. DO NOT RECOMMEND.
Activity days are the easiest! He doesn't remind you when something is due! DO YOUR LABS AND CRITICAL THINKING QUESTIONS and you will do fine. The tests are very difficult. You will need to study.

I signed up for this class and the professor was TBA. Teacher ended up being pretty good. His lectures are decently interesting. I also to the Friday class that was from 11-1:45 and we were ALWAYS let out early. Test are somewhat challenging. It definitely tests to see if you know the material. Pretty good class overall.

the test are multiple choice they are very hard you MUST study, He knows what hes talking about the activity days are difficult esp compared to the other professor Hes hot and know his stuff test are just difficult but its almost impossible to fail his class if you do everything

I just got out of his class, I'm scheduled to be in there till 3:15 and at 2:35 he asked me and my friend if we were done with our test, we said yes, then he told us to leave although we were studying quietly by ourselves. He's a jerk! Do not take him. He squeezed my thigh fat and it bruised. He told me i was obese and i weigh 119! JERK!
Please never take this professor if it's your last resort.  Find professor who likes his job.  I will not recommend him to teach.  He needs not be in the classroom.

People like to complain too much. ike the person (s?) below said just pay attention to your syllabus and you'll be time. People in class would ask questions all the time, and when something was due, half the class was surprised, even though it's in the syllabus you recieve the 1st day of class. Tests are hard, but other points make up for it. EasyA

0h please! The recent posts are made by one student - most likely a nursing graduate who already knew most of the content and impressed Mr.Wilhoyte. This is the ONLY student he would work with. I'm 46 - been on the Pres list for quite some time. He's unprofessional and not friendly. Don't take him.

i really don't get these ratings, he posts when assignments are due in the syllabus so i dont understand why people are saying he's not clear when things are due. he changed my grade when i had a question. tests are somewhat hard but show up for activity days and do all the quizzes and labs on time and you'll be fine
don't listen to ratings by people who obviously dont know how to read their syllabus to know how to do things and to know when they're due. grow up!!

people need to grow up. they're saying he's not clear on when things are due, but they are all in the SYLLABUS we receive the first day of class! we're adults people!! he was more than happy to change a grade when i had a question. tests are somewhat difficult, but show up for the the activities and do all the quizzes and you'll be fine.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! I wish I had heeded the warnings on this website because they are spot-on. He could care less about the class and the students. He will make you feel like you are a complete idiot regardless of the question or situation. Please find another professor to take this class!!!

Do your best to take a different prof. He's mean &  unapproachable (I'm actually afraid to ask him any questions now) & his assignments are never due on the same day  on different class periods. His study guides are useless, and his powerpoints don't help with studying. He makes this class harder than it should be.

My sentiments are exactly as the comments on 3/31/11 and 4/1/11  I am concerned that in this class there is no warm up and that with the weight lifting portion of this activity class someone is going to get seriously hurt. Actually in our class i believe someone was hurt and brought in a physicians note.

DO NOT TAKE WILHOYTE. Sign up for 1850 next semester with someone else, if need be. Looking at the trend on RMP, in danger of being fired? His attitude worsens every term. Might know his stuff(?), but he's the worst communicator ever-verbally, nonverbal, on paper, timeliness. Very important in an ACTIVITY CLASS!

He obviously hates his job. Somedays he's in a somewhat cheerful mood, but it usually goes away quickly. He's boring, activity days are mandatory. The quizzes are from the book, he lectures off powerpoint, and the tests he pulls from...

DO NOT take this class! He is rude and extremely unclear with the assignments. All he does is read off the powerpoints, and the quizzes don't come from the lectures. The tests are very confusing. He gives study guides, but it doesn't even help with the test. He takes this class WAY too seriously and has no personality. STAY AWAY!!

Please Please Please do yourself a favor and choose another instructor.  He is extremely boring and comes across as not liking his job.  I got an A in the class but only because I read the book, did the activities,etc.  it would have been nice to have an instructor that made it interesting especially since you HAVE to take this class to graduate.

Professor Wilhoyte has been one of my least favorite teachers. He NEVER replies to emails or is available for questions. Most of the time he doesn't seem to care but he lets class out almost always at least 30 minutes early. The first test is really easy all you need to do is memorize, but the next ones are very tough! Final is optional.

He is the laziest professor of all time. He hates his job and makes no effort to connect to students. Grades were a complete mystery until seen on transcript. He grades short answer questions without reason or logic. He should not be teaching at the college level.

It's an HPS class so it's not that hard. This professor obviously hates his job. He lets you know your test scores but thats about it. I did not know what my grade in the class was until the very last day because he is so unorganized and lazy. He's not always clear on what you need to do. His tests are a little too complicated for the subject he's

He is the general "coach" teacher. Lectures are in a lecture hall. He doesn't speak loud enough to understand him. He has a terrible attitude. It's a fairly easy class but you are not prepared by lectures alone. It takes a good bit of outside studying. Mandatory attendance on exam and activity days.

If you do the reading and work you should end up with an easy A/B. Attendance is mandatory due to labs and in-class physical activity.  He claims to want class participation, but looks at you like you're dumb if you answer wrong or ask a "dumb" question. If you do the work you should get an A/B. There are profs who are easier/have less tests

This is probably one of the worst teachers I've had here at Kennesaw so far. He acts like he doesn't want to be there and if you ask him a question he will make you feel stupid. He takes his tests way too seriously. He gives quizzes and never tells you about them so I failed three out of 4. I made a B in this stupid class, which should be an easy A

If you can find someone else take them. He is very disorganized (which is NOT good). He is very impersonal. He comes across like he does not want to be there. His first test followed his study guide, his second test did not. He is not helpful,can be kinda rude too.

Very boring lectures, mere powerpoint reading. Much of the information is from biology and psychology, easy A if you're into those. Three main tests, one optional final, pedometer project, 6 hours of club sports/rec center classes/volunteer work, short pop quizzes here and there, activity days.

This class is NOT an easy A. The tests are difficult and don't exactly correspond with the Powerpoints, so you need to take notes on just about everything he says. He's a nice guy and he usually lets class out early, but I would recommend someone else.

Not a very hard class. Just pay attention, study power points, and read chapters in the text book and you will get a good grade. Class usually gets out early. 6 hrs of outside activity required. Not a lot of homework other than studying for test and quizzes.

He is so freakin cute! I really liked him. He is very intelligent, and straightforward about what he wants. Do the 6 activity days they are easy. Do your labs also easy, and when he says there will be a quiz study. dont be stupid an get a bad grade on an easy quiz. There are 6 hours of outside activity to, do that and listen and youll make an easy

Smart, educated teacher.The ONLY problem with this class was the 3 tests! He does not make his powerpoints or tests so the tests are random. He replaces your lowest test grade with your highest so that helped me get an A. Just do the outside activity, do the labs, and show up to class and you should pull out an A. LETS CLASS OUT 20-40 MIN. EARLY!!

Not the most exciting professor I've had, honestly.  Being an educator, myself, I think he can originate his own tests and quizzes to match the lectures in the class.  The power point notes are not his words and compositions.  They are from the publisher.  Therefore, read the chapters and take the practice quizzes at the end of each section.

He was really enthusiastic, and I felt bad because most people hate health class/PE.  He tried his best and really knew a lot about the subject. He is in good shape, so it's not like you are being taught by a hypocrite.

Worst Professor ever. He read straight from the book. I fell asleep almost every class. Impossible quizzes after every chapter only 5 questions, you'll fail most of them. The study guides he hands out before tests help a little. Get out of every class early, at the least 20 minutes, at the most 45 minutes. 6 hrs of activity and labs bring up grade.

This professor is useless. he reads directly from the book. and doesn't fully explain the exercises that he wants us to do. he seems to think that everyone is in good physical condition and expects everyone to be able to perform at the same level. He cannot seem to fully teach the material and even said that he was not qualified to teach

he reads directly from the book. he is so boring. he makes you do "work out days" where he doesn't properly teach you the exercises. He doesn't show you how to properly stretch and warm up before the exercises. He just thinks that running is enough.
His class was pretty easy, but otherwise was boring and pointless. I would take a more interesting professor for a such a boring class.

Not good. Random questions on test. Questions were worded funny. He was questioned several times about saying one thing in class and then marking it wrong on the test, but he was to cocky to accept that he was wrong. Tons of labs and projects. I did make an A, but I earned it.

Loved him! Not a bad teacher but a really fair teacher. Do what you're supposed to and its an easy A. (The 6 activity hrs were actually fun.) Since the test don't count for THAT much, you dint have to do really really well to secure an A. Just do the activity hours!
Professor is obvious green. If you get good grades on everything and don't have time for the 6 hour volunteer service you get a bad grade.  Didn't think he was that silly.
He requires 6 volunteer hours, otherwise an easy A!
If you want an easy HPS class this is the class to go to.

He reads straight from the book and makes note taking difficult. His lectures are  broad, which make the tests broad. "Activity Days" are a must, as well as different projects throughout the semester. Even if you do good on the tests, you can still get a bad grade if you don't do the projects. He's not a bad teacher, just inexperienced.
Very easy class, reads from the book and all the quizzes are straight out of the book. Just do the 6hrs of activity and pedometer project and you have an easy A.
